com.barrybecker4.common.expression.mathexpression
Class MathExpressionParser

java.lang.Object
  com.barrybecker4.common.expression.ExpressionParser
      com.barrybecker4.common.expression.mathexpression.MathExpressionParser

public class MathExpressionParser
extends ExpressionParser

Parses the text form of an expression (in x) into a tree representation. Create a subclass for parsing a math expression.

Method Detail

getNodesAtLevel

protected java.util.List<TreeNode> getNodesAtLevel(java.lang.String exp)
Recursive method to find all the tree nodes for the terms a the current level. For example, given this expression 2x^3 + 5(x + 3x^2) / (x - 1) the items in []'s represent the array of nodes returned. [2] [*] [x] [^] [3] [+] [5][*][x + 3x^2] [/] [x - 1] The parts that were in {()'s become their own subtrees via recursive calls.

Specified by:
getNodesAtLevel in class ExpressionParser
Parameters:
exp - the expression to get the nodes at the current level for
Returns:
array of nodes representing terms that the current level.
Throws:
java.lang.Error - if there is a syntax error causing the expression to be invalid

                                                java.lang.String token,
                                                int closingParenPos,
                                                java.util.List<TreeNode> nodes)
Parse a parenthesized sub expression recursively.

Specified by:
processSubExpression in class ExpressionParser
Returns:
current token. May have been reset to "".

pushNodesForToken

protected void pushNodesForToken(java.lang.String token,
                                 java.util.List<TreeNode> nodes)
The token may represent several nodes because of implicit multiplication. For example, -4x should become [-4] [times] [x] -x should become [-1] [times] [x]

Specified by:
pushNodesForToken in class ExpressionParser
Parameters:
token - the token to parse
nodes - array of nodes that the token was parsed into.

makeTreeFromNodes

protected TreeNode makeTreeFromNodes(java.util.List<TreeNode> nodes)
Converts a list of nodes to a single node by reducing them to subtrees in order of operator precedence.

Specified by:
makeTreeFromNodes in class ExpressionParser
